headline: Plane Flying Cargo for Amazon Crashes in Texas
summary: A plane flying cargo for Amazon.com crashed in Texas with three people on board, leaving a large debris field in a bay near Houston, authorities said.

headline: Officials Play Down Appearance of Rift Between Trump and Lighthizer on Trade
summary: U.S. trade officials are looking to knock down speculation of a split on China policy between President Trump and his lead trade negotiator, Robert Lighthizer, following a testy exchange between the two in the Oval Office Friday.

headline: Kim Jong Un Heads to Hanoi for Meeting With Trump
summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un left Pyongyang by train for Hanoi, North Korean state media reported, in its first official acknowledgment of the closely watched two-day summit meeting with President Trump.

headline: U.S. Allies Spurred a Partial Reversal of Trump’s Syria Withdrawal Plan
summary: The Trump administration decision to keep hundreds of U.S. troops based in Syria was driven by allies who said they wouldn’t stay behind to prevent a resurgence of Islamic State without an American presence, a senior U.S. defense official said.

headline: Showdown at Venezuela-Colombia Border
summary: Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro said he was breaking diplomatic ties with neighboring Colombia amid a showdown over humanitarian. Opposition leader Juan Guaido is trying to bring international humanitarian aid into Venezuela from Colombia, but Mr. Maduro denies a humanitarian crisis exists.

headline: Photos: Marella Agnelli’s Life in Style
summary: The Italian style icon and widow to the late Fiat chairman Gianni Agnelli inspired fashion photographers like Richard Avedon, designers like Valentino Garavani, and writers like Truman Capote. A stylish life in photographs.

headline: PG&E To Scrap Employee Bonuses After Protest From Fire Victims
summary: PG&E is planning to scrap $130 million in bonuses owed to thousands of employees, a move that comes after protests from victims of several California wildfires.

headline: Are Stocks Worth Their Price?
summary: Unable to find an elephant-sized acquisition, Warren Buffett said Berkshire would likely be expanding its portfolio of stocks instead. Considering where valuations are, even that hunt for smaller game could be trying.

headline: Nigeria’s Election Gets Under Way After a Stop-Start Runup
summary: After a false start and an acrimonious campaign, Nigerians headed to the polls to vote in what is expected to be Africa’s largest-ever election, and will determine who governs the continent’s top economy and oil producer.

headline: ‘Apex Legends’ Is EA’s Move to Out-Fortnite ‘Fortnite’
summary: “Apex Legends,” the free, last-man-standing videogame that Electronic Arts launched Feb. 4 with no fanfare, is the first challenger to crack the armor of Epic Games Inc.’s juggernaut “Fortnite.”

headline: London Fashion Week 2019: WSJ. Magazine’s 20 Favorite Looks
summary: Last week in London, designers presented one of their strongest and most joyful seasons in recent memory.

headline: Despite Tight Job Market, Labor Force’s Income Is Squeezed
summary: With the U.S. labor market so tight that companies routinely complain of shortages, you’d think American workers are getting a bigger slice of the nation’s economic pie. But they’re not.

headline: IRS Proposal Could Crimp Earnings for Manufacturers, Energy Companies
summary: The tax overhaul fueled earnings for many companies. Now, a proposal from the Internal Revenue Service about how to implement part of the measure could crimp a key tax break for certain manufacturing and energy companies.

headline: In New York, Don’t Just Drink Your Coffee—Learn About It First
summary: For many New Yorkers, getting coffee is a no-nonsense everyday ritual. But for others, it has become a multisensory experience as some cafes create ways for guests to learn about coffee or enjoy it in unexpected ways.

headline: LaGuardia’s High-Flying Makeover Has Travelers Doing Double-Takes
summary: New York’s LaGuardia Airport is midway through an $8 billion renovation—and the floor-to-ceiling windows and luxurious bathrooms have customers taking notice.

headline: Approval Rate Declines for H-1B Visas
summary: The Trump administration is demanding supporting evidence in many more applications for coveted H-1B visas for high-skilled foreign workers, and denying more petitions.

headline: After Confronting Macron, France’s Yellow Vest Movement Turns on Itself
summary: The protest movement is bitterly divided over whether to coalesce into a formal organization or keep its antiestablishment roots, as it presses President Macron for change

headline: ‘Beyond Truth: Photography After the Shutter’ Review: The Ever-Evolving Image
summary: An exhibition at the Cleveland Museum of Art reveals the malleable nature of photography.

headline: Gene Simmons on KISS and Capitalism
summary: Gene Simmons, co-founder and co-lead singer of KISS, talks about the intersection of music and money in his world.

headline: Photos: Venezuela-Brazil Border Becomes the Site of Maduro’s Power Struggle
summary: The Venezuelan president has established a military blockade at the border to counter efforts by opposition leader Juan Guaidó to deliver humanitarian aid.

headline: Roche Agrees to Buy Biotech Firm Spark Therapeutics
summary: The Swiss drugmaker agreed to acquire U.S.-based Spark for $114.50 a share in a deal with an equity value of about $4.8 billion as it seeks to expand its presence treating hemophilia.

headline: What’s News: World-Wide
summary: What’s News: World-Wide

headline: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Pepper...and Salt

headline: What’s News: Business & Finance
summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

headline: Violence Erupts in Venezuela Border Showdown
summary: A high-stakes effort to deliver aid into Venezuela despite a military blockade descended into violence Saturday, with hundreds injured and more than 60 National Guard forces defecting to Colombia.

headline: Buffett’s Kraft Heinz Bet Dragged Down Berkshire Hathaway
summary: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway swung to a $25.4 billion loss in the fourth quarter due to an unexpected write-down at Kraft Heinz and unrealized investment losses.

headline: An Elite Ice Climber’s Year-Round Workout
summary: Angela Limbach, an ice climber ranked 36th among the world’s women, varies her training during the year, focusing on strength in the spring, endurance in the summer and technical precision in the fall.

headline: At Trump-Kim Summit, Vietnam Blazes Trail for North Korea
summary: When North Korean leader Kim Jong Un meets President Trump in Hanoi, the venue itself will carry a message for the dictator: Cooperate with the U.S. and you will open the door to an economic transformation like Vietnam’s.

headline: On-Demand Grandkids and Robot Pals to Keep Senior Loneliness at Bay
summary: Devices and services that facilitate—and in some cases replace—human contact are attracting insurers looking to combat an ever-more lethal crisis of loneliness.
